review_blob: First off... Lagunitas is one of my new favorite breweries. I think Hop Stupid is my favorite IPA in the world. Second off Ive learned that Kansas is the first state that this beer was released in, which is confusing and amazing since the brewery is in California... but Ill take it. This beer is quite amazing. The aroma is very hoppy and fruity but not the normal floral and citrus notes that you get from IPAs.  The taste is much the same. For the moment that is where I will leave you, Boulevard Dark Truth also came out today and I need to get onto that.

Oooo Im so excited. It just came into the store today. Sadly enough I am drinking this out of Barenjager mug and hiding it below the counter between customers, but I couldnt wait. A deep hazy golden brown with a frothy tan head and a caramel, citrus and surprisingly enough, rye aroma. Mildly sweet and spicy with a medium slick body and active carbonation and a slightly biting finish. Overall an awesome awesome beer. Rye whiskey in a most joyous form.

A very bright and clear golden beer with an abundance of tiny bubbles trickling to the top. Crisp yeasty spicy nose. A very light yeasty bitterness with a light body, stronger than average carbonation and an abrupt finish.

This thing pours a beautiful golden amber of the gods color. Im in love with the look of this beer. I get kind of a sweet yeastyness on the nose that continues into the taste. The palate is also wonderful with a full creamy body, average carbonation and an average finish. Overall a beautiful looking and feeling beer with an above average aroma and taste
beer_name: Grand Teton Lost Continent Double IPA

review_blob: Light citrus and flora hop aroma. Very light amber color with a thin soapy white head. Medium bitterness with a light body, lively carbonation and a short finish.
A beautiful deep reddish-brown color with a strong fruity, caramel aroma, strong but delicate campaign like carbonation and a lasting finish.
beer_name: Bear Republic Hop Rod Rye Ale

review_blob: Light but very floral smell of hops. Hazy orange color with a frothy white head that dissipates quickly. Heavy, heavy bitterness. Light body, slick texture with good carbonation, a short bitter finish with a trailing sweetness.  Overall an extremely well balance and crafted beer.  For the longest time I though I didnt like IPAs but with more beers like this it may soon become my favorite.
Beautiful deep brown cloudy color with a rich cream colored head. Mild sweet aroma. Malty medium sweetness. Medium body, creamy texture with a long finish.
